courseTitle: Recognizing and Responding to Intimate Partner Violence
courseSubtitle: Understanding, Identifying, and Supporting Survivors of IPV
description: This comprehensive training course provides essential knowledge for recognizing, understanding, and responding to intimate partner violence (IPV). The course covers the dynamics of IPV, including various forms of abuse, the Power and Control Wheel framework, sexual violence in intimate relationships, and evidence-based strategies for supporting survivors. Learners will develop critical skills to identify signs of abuse, understand the impact on victims, and implement appropriate response strategies including safety planning.

learningObjectives.terminal: Upon completion, learners will be able to recognize signs of intimate partner violence, understand its impact on victims and survivors, and implement appropriate response strategies including safety planning and resource referral.
enabling: Identify and describe various types of intimate partner violence including physical, emotional, sexual, and economic abuse
Analyze abusive relationship dynamics using the Duluth Model's Power and Control Wheel framework
Recognize the unique characteristics and prevalence of intimate partner sexual violence
Assess the psychological, physical, and social impacts of IPV on victims and survivors
Apply trauma-informed approaches when responding to individuals experiencing intimate partner violence
Develop and facilitate safety planning strategies with IPV survivors
Identify appropriate resources and referral pathways for IPV support services

instructionalApproach.methodology: Case-based learning with evidence-based frameworks and interactive scenarios
engagement: Case analysis activities (e.g., Lois and James Sumpter case study)
Framework application exercises (Power and Control Wheel)
Visual infographics and statistical data presentations

assessmentStrategy.formative: Interactive knowledge checks embedded within lessons and case analysis activities
assessmentStrategy.summative: Module quizzes after each of the 3 main modules plus comprehensive final course assessment
assessmentStrategy.practiceOpportunities: Case-based scenarios, power dynamics analysis, and safety planning exercises
